answers.answer: Yes I totally felt like that after my c-section. But I had a hard time going to the bathroom. It hurt to push if you kow what I mean. Also if your nursing, pumping you will loose tons of weight from that.If you keep nursing after a while your will get your hunger back and want to eat non stop. I would eat non stop and still loose weight.Mabye just check with the doc just to be safe. Look over your after c-section insctuctions as well.

i definitely don't have a hard time going! i think i'll call the dr tomorrow and just make sure it doesn't have anything to do with the c-sec. it was much worse last night.so it's normal to be losing about a pound/day since i've been home???

If you have lost 22 lbs since the delivery and it has been almsot 2 weeks, I think that is normal.You have to remember you lost at least half that and then some the day you had your baby.You may have lost 17 lbs. just from that.

question: i had an emergency c-section 12 days ago due to preeclampsia. i never really got my appetite back, but i think it's because my stomach probably shrank from not being to eat much when i was so big. i can eat, i just don't really feel hungry and find myself forgetting to eat. in the past few days it seems like i have stopped digesting food properly. i really don't think it's a stomach bug or anything- no stomach pains, no fever. tmi, i know... but what goes in comes out in pretty much the same condition. it's not frequent diarrhea, just not long after i eat a meal. could this be related to the c-section or the preeclampsia? did anyone else who had a c-sec experience anything like this? i've lost 22 lbs since delivering. i thought it was just because i had retained so much fluid, and because i am pumping (baby still won't latch). any insight would be appreciated. thanks.
title: post c-section questions
